name: Long double
description: Pot the red after cushion. Thanks to double, you will learn to recognize less obvious moves, you will gain confidence in such plays.

name: Two low reds
description: Pot the red ball with the highest possible color and then clear the sequence of colors. Remember about good positioning!

name: Long double pot
description: Set the balls according to the scheme and then pocket the red double. Try to backside the white ball to a safe place.

name: Release the reds
description: Position the cue ball in such a way that release the reds is as easy as possible. It's important to get positions for the next red after being released.

name: Simple double
description: Contrary to appearances, pocketing a red ball with a double is not a difficult shot. By practicing such strokes, you will notice that, on the contrary, they are quite easy.

name: Angles on the double
description: In this exercise, we practice pocketing the double ball, but from different angles. Watch out for the double capture!

name: Double to corner
description: Hitting a double into a corner pocket can sometimes be less obvious. Practice and surprise your opponent. Watch out for double capturing the cue ball.

name: 15 Reds in straight line
description: Set the red balls according to the scheme. The cue ball from anywhere. Clear the table on the first try.

name: Snooker for snooker
description: Escape from snooker leaving the snooker to your opponent. Going snooker is only half the battle, it's more important not to leave your opponent with an easy game.

name: Easy snooker
description: Line up the balls as shown in the diagram. Hit the cue ball in such a way that after bouncing off the cushion it hits the pink ball. Your first out of snooker.
